article.Heading: Union Budget 2016-17: Sensex, Nifty still in green; FM says FY16-17 to be challenging
article.Summary: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley says in his Budget speech that India's external situation is robust but FY16-17 will be challenging. He said that the government will make provision for bank recapitalisation and social sector in FY17. He will focus to pass GST.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

After a sudden spurt, the market has eased off gains a  bit. The Sensex is up 62.29 points or 0.3 percent at 23216.59, and the Nifty is up 10.10 points or 0.1 percent at 7039.85. About 978 shares have advanced, 1062 shares declined, and 112 shares are unchanged.

SBI, Tata Steel, ONGC, ICICI Bank and M&M are top gainers while Wipro, GAIL, Infosys, NTPC and Maruti are down.

Finance Minister Arun Jaitley says in his Budget speech that India's external situation is robust but FY16-17 will be challenging. He said that the government will make provision for bank recapitalisation and social sector in FY17. He will focus to pass GST.

Posted by Nasrin Sultana
Follow @NasrinzStory
